==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|はつ|もの|yomi=kun}}

===Etymology===
Compound of {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=はつもの}} elements {{compound|lang=ja|sort=はつもの|初|tr1=hatsu|t1=first|物|tr2=mono|t2=thing}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

===Pronunciation===
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|訓読み|Kun'yomi}}
* {{ja-accent-common|h|は|つもの}}<ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[ha̠t͡sɯᵝmo̞no̞]}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|はつもの}}

# the first [[crop]] or [[harvest]] of the [[season]]
#: {{ja-usex|'''初物'''のメロンを頂きました。|'''はつもの''' の メロン を いただきました。|I received the '''first''' melon '''of the season'''.}}
# a [[virgin]]

====Derived terms====
* {{ja-l|初物食}}, {{ja-l|初物食い|はつものぐい|hatsumono-gui}}: a preference for eating the first foods of the season; by extension, a preference for new things; a person with such preferences; a [[libertine]] who targets virgins
